title.term: Album Ducler 3: Vues, fêtes du Jamsé, du feu, des accrochés; Cérémonies relatives aux pagodes, aux mariages, aux obsèques; Char du soleil

repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: 3rd series of gouache paintings commissioned by Ducler in 1831.
In this series of 18 gouache paintings are found illustrations of festivals, ceremonies from India (particularly from South India).

collation.desc: the front cover. BnF shelfmark sticker on verso.
2 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Blank except for BnF old shelfmark on f[1]r.
1 folio = Title Page. No foliation. Double folio unfolded. Verso blank.
18 folios = Gouache Paintings. Library Arabic foliation 1-18 in black ink. Parallel original (?) Arabic foliation 2c-18c in black pencil for f2-f18. Double folios unfolded. Verso blank.
2 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
the back cover. With BnF restoration sticker.

layoutDesc.layout: Black frame divided in two boxes: the upper, larger, box for the gouache painting; the lower, smaller box for bilingual labels (Tamil in Tamil script and French in Latin script).

decoNote.desc: Royal cypher N, of Napoléon III (spine).

additions.desc: Library's name (spine): B. IMP, that is, Bibliothèque Impériale.
Title printed in golden letters (spine): CÉRÉMONIES RELIGIEUSES DE L'INDE
BnF current shelfmark sticker (front cover, verso): INDIEN 746
BnF old shelfmark in black ink (f[1]r): Indien 101.
Library stamp (red ink) (u2, f[1]r; in the labels box of every recto folio of U1): B.R (below a crown, both in an oval), that is, Bibliothèque Royale.
BnF restoration sticker (back cover, recto): BnF Richelieu Atelier de Restauration 2009

binding.p: Library binding. With name of the library, title, royal cypher and binder's name on the spine.

origin.origDate: See "1831" in the lower right corner of the labels box of every recto folio of U1.

provenance.p: Gouache paintings commissioned by Philippe Étienne Ducler (1778-1840), colonial administrator in Karikal (Karaikkāl). See Burnouf (1832, p. 86).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler (BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 95 (3e série).

listBibl.bibl: Burnouf, Eugène. 1832. “Rapport fait au Conseil, dans la séance du 2 juillet 1832, sur les collections de manuscrits et de dessins rapportées de l’Inde par M. Ducler, administrateur de Carical, membre de la Société asiatique.” Journal asiatique 10, p. 84-87. — Report by E. Burnouf & J. B. Eyriès.
Cabaton, Antoine, 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 109-100, no. 746.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.

revisionDesc.change: Revised by Emmanuel FRANCIS. Version 1, June 2022.

ab.term:
civa-matam-uḷḷavaḷum-āy veḷḷāḻa-c-cātiyum-ākiya y-oru tamuḻ-c-cāti peṇpiḷḷaiyiṉ tukkaccaṭaṅku. Avaḷai Akkiṉi-p-piṟavēcatukkuḷḷ ākka-p pōṟārkaḷ. Avaḷuṭaiya kumāraṉ y-oru tōṇ
ṭiyil taṇṇīr eṭuttu-k-koṇṭu Avaṉ tokappaṉoppantam-āy ciracai tiṟantu-k-koṇṭu pōṟāṉ tukkatukku-p pōṟavarkaḷ talai-p pāvukku vatalāy leñci kaṭṭi koṇṭirukkiṟārkaḷ cātippiḷḷai
cuṭukāṭṭil koḷḷi vaiykkiṟatukku neruppu koṇṭu pōṟāṉ piṟetattai Atikayoṭṭa lōkamāy koṇṭu pōṟatukkāka pūmiyil naṭai pāvaṭaiyum virintu-k-koṇṭu pōṟārkaḷ.

Obsèques d'une femme malabare de la secte de Shiven et de caste Vellaja que l'on va bruler. Son fils porte l'eau lustrale dans une panelle et a la tête découverte
ainsi que son père. Les afsistans ont des mouchoirs qui remplacent la toque. Des serviteurs de caste portent le feu qui doit servir à embrasser le bucher &
des toiles sont étendues à terre pour que le corps y pafse plus décemment.

piṟakācam-uṭaittāṉ piṟatāṉa-varṇaṅkaḷ-uḷḷa Ēḻu kutirai-vākaṉaṅkaḷāl kaṭṭi y-iḻukkappaṭṭaṟtattiṉ pēril eḻuntaruḷi
y-irukkum cūriya-pakavāṉ. Inta ratattai moṭavaṉ-ākiya Aruṇaṉ naṭatti-k-koṇṭu poṟāṉ.

Le Dieu Souria ou le Soleil sur son char traîné par sept chevaux qui ont chacun une des couleurs
primitives de la lumière et conduit par Arounan qui a les extrêmités inférieures estropiées
